comment: Dr Labriola is a KING!!!!! So kind, funny, and doesn't absolutely roast you in grading like some other profs in the program will.

Dr. Labriola is one of the best professors I have had at KSU. He is quick in responding to emails, gives great guidance for assignments, and is an overall kind person. Your grade is based on writing assignments, a major group project (you can choose to work alone), and quizzes that you can take whenever you want over the course of the semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Labriola is a very laid back and an easy grader. If you looking for an easy A, take him!

Dr. Labriola is an amazing professor. You can tell he loves his job and his students. He makes sure his students have a clear understanding of what is expected from him. He is always willing to lend a helping hand both in and out of the classroom. He's super nice and creates that personal relationship with all his students.

Dr. L is one of the best professors I've had at KSU. He's a genuinely nice guy and is very informed about his subject matter. He starts every class by showing available job listings/internships for our major which I always found interesting. Dr. L is extremely helpful and is almost always available on MS Teams. 10/10, would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: As Ive seen other posts mention Dr Labriola can sometimes be really delayed getting your feedback on assignments, but when he does he gives really detailed comments. He is always available to chat on teams which made asking questions and getting help really easy. He definitely cares about his students but he just takes a long time grading

He got married this summer and it took a really long time to get assignments back. really didn't know what grade I had for a while. Other than that he always responded to my messages in teams and when i finally got feedback on papers he was really helpful

One of the best professors at KSU. You can tell he really cares for his students and wants you to succeed. The class itself will require a lot of time management, but Dr. Labriola is willing to work with students. He gives clear instructions and is accessible via email if you ever need help. You won't regret taking Dr. Labriola!

As clear, caring, and considerate as any professor could ever be! He truly loves technical writing, and his ability to articulate the material is so great, it doesn't even truly feel like a lecture, but a conversation. A 1-2 question quiz every week (easy), and about 5-6 major writing assignments. If you have a chance, take him!

I highly recommend taking Dr. Labriola if you have the option. Even with class being mostly online during this Fall 2020 semester, the class remained highly organized and myself and other students were still able to learn and succeed. Nothing but positive comments about him. Take him!

I've taken Dr. Labriola for 3 classes now and he is my favorite professor at KSU. This was the first class that I've taken with him online due to COVID but hes still just as accessible (maybe even more with teams messages) and has been so flexible in terms of deadlines and assignments. He really does care about his students and I love his classes

Dr. Labriola was an AMAZING teacher to have. I took his class online during 2020 Summer semester. He uploaded videos of his lectures (usually 20 mins max), and he was very helpful and accessible if you emailed him. He does so much work behind the scenes for his students to succeed. He made the class super easy. Only downside is a group project.

With our course being moved online for the summer i was unsure as to how hard this class was going to be. Dr. Labriola took the time to prerecord lectures, send out weekly recap emails with videos attached, and give extensions to all that needed during a crazy semester with the pandemic going on. He cares about his students and always helped us out

Hes new to KSU and already many students favorite professor. Like the other reviews have mentioned, Dr. Labriola is very caring and accommodating. Early in the semester you will read about a chapter of the textbook every week but the quizzes are few and not terribly difficult. Hes also happy to review resumes and cover letters which I recommend!

Our semester isnt over yet but I wanted to quickly share that Dr. Labriola really cares about his students. With all classes being moved online Dr. Labriola has been the one professor to continuously reach out, keep us informed and check up on us. Things arent as great as they could be, he's doing his best for all of us and I can tell he cares.

Professor labriola is one of the most caring professors I've ever met at KSU. After 3 years of having professors just see me as just another student in the class, Professor Labriola really showed that he knew who I was, and took the time to learn more about us as people. He really cares about his students and I think we all appreciated his class

Dr. Labs was an amazing professor. Even though this was his first year here, I'm really glad I got to have him. He did a great job making classes fun and entertaining. We would start every class with bad designs in the world where we got a chance to laugh and see how technical communications can improve even the most simple designs we use everyday
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Labriola is new to KSU and this was his first class he taught. Even tho he was new, class was great. I didn't know what I was expecting in a class called technical writing but Dr. L really made the class enjoyable and it became one of my favorite classes. He made each class engaging and fun. Tho there's a big group project at the end it was fun
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects
